entry.title: Run Statutory Reports App: fetches the data from the Archived database
entry.content:
Does the application run statutory reports App ID F1515 fetches the data from the Archived database or not?

 


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: Run Statutory Reports App: fetches the data from the...
entry.content:
Dear all,

 

Please note, data archiving is used to manage data at the end of its lifecycle in SAP S/4HANA Cloud, Public Edition by blocking and deleting personal data. When the end of purpose is reached, personal data is moved from the database to archive files and is implicitly marked as blocked. Blocked data is subject to access restrictions to prevent further unauthorized processing

 

The 'Manage Archiving Variants' app, choose the archiving object and schedule archiving.

 

We can use the archiving object SRF_TASK for archiving reporting tasks in statutory reporting.

 

Please refer the below help document for more information,

https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/4de200b26d5d42bbacae69c6bf6b9923/cb2ee9a6517f499299e8c03fad46e373.html?version=LATEST&locale=en-US

 

Best regards,

Atanu

SAP Support - S/4HANA Cloud

entry.title: Re: Run Statutory Reports App: fetches the data from the...
entry.content:
Dear all,

 

Please note, data archiving is used to delete data at the end of its lifecycle and to block and delete personal data in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition. Archiving moves the personal data from the database to archive files if the end of purpose is reached. In doing so, the personal data is implicitly marked as blocked. Blocked data has access restrictions to prevent further unauthorized processing.

 

The 'Manage Archiving Variants' app, choose the archiving object and schedule archiving.

 

We can use the archiving object SRF_TASK for archiving reporting tasks in statutory reporting.

 

Please refer the below help document for more information,

https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/4de200b26d5d42bbacae69c6bf6b9923/cb2ee9a6517f499299e8c03fad46e373.html?version=LATEST&locale=en-US

 

Best regards,

Atanu

SAP Support - S/4HANA Cloud

entry.title: CSRF Token handling for ABAP Cloud Client Proxies
entry.content:
As on SAP S/4 HANA â‰¥ 2025, we are able to create http clients as Tier 1 ABAP Cloud compatible syntax. From my research, the unified approach  for ABAP syntax that can run on Public Cloud & on-prem systems will require we use Communication Targets. For example:

DATA: lo_client_proxy TYPE REF TO /iwbep/if_cp_client_proxy,
      lo_http_client  TYPE REF TO if_web_http_client,
      lo_cota         TYPE REF TO /coss/cota_internal.

lo_cota = NEW /coss/cota_internal(  ).
lo_http_client = lo_cota->create_web_http_client( ).

lo_client_proxy = /iwbep/cl_cp_factory_remote=>create_v4_remote_proxy(
  EXPORTING
    is_proxy_model_key = VALUE #( repository_id = 'DEFAULT'
                                  proxy_model_id  = lv_proxy_model
                                  proxy_model_version = lv_model_vers )
    io_http_client             = lo_http_client
    iv_relative_service_root   = '/sap/opu/odata4/sap/....' ).

Behind the scenes, /coss/cota_internal will be created based on the ABAP version you are running. In our case, I am supporting Public Cloud & on-Prem 2025+.

For Public Cloud - Communication Targets require: 1) communication scenario, 2) communication arrangmement and communication system configuration. This scenario is testing correctly.

For On-Prem - Communication Targets (COTA) are automatically visible in transaction 'APPLDEST' and require an Application Destination be set-up underneath the COTA. For our purposes, we want to create the client proxy to read the local ABAP Application Server, therefore we point the application destination to our own system.

 

The code above to generate client proxies, continues to work for on-prem systems but when ->execute( ) hits, a CSRF exception hits. As ABAP Cloud developers our ability to manage CSRF tokens is tightly restricted as the framework is meant to manage their usage.



/iwbep/cl_cp_request explicitly blocking developers from setting a x-csrf-token fetch

How can we interact with SAP API Hub Client Proxies using on-stack ABAP Cloud Syntax for S/4 HANA 2025 and newer systems?

 



 

 

 

__PRESENT__PRESENT__PRESENT__PRESENT__PRESENT__PRESENT

entry.title: Re: Batch Valuation Activation At Material Level
entry.content: Yes you cannot activate batch valuation on standard HALB/FERT in Public Cloud. Copying them into ZHALB/ZFERT and activating batch valuation is the correct and supported approach. This aligns with SAPâ€™s extensibility model for Public Cloud and is safe for future releases (like 2508).
